thread.title: Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain's Latest Social Media Activity Could Land Him In Trouble
thread.title_full: Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain's Latest Social Media Activity Could Land Him In Trouble

title: Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain's Latest Social Media Activity Could Land Him In Trouble
text:
Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain's Latest Social Media Activity Could Land Him In Trouble Sat Feb 04 2017 15:38:45   15:38:45 GMT+0000 (GMT) Josh Lawless Josh Lawless in football 
A miserable week for Arsenal continued with a dismal showing at Chelsea this lunchtime, with the Gunners losing 3-1 at Stamford Bridge. 
Goals from Marcos Alonso, Eden Hazard and former Arsenal man Cesc Fabregas gave the league leaders a 3-0 lead, before Olivier Giroud added a consolation goal for the visitors. 
Mesut Ozil was visibly frustrated at the final whistle, with the German looking extremely annoyed at teammates Alexis Sanchez and Nacho Monreal. 
And Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain showed his frustrations in a different way and it could get him in a spot of bother. 
That's because the England midfielder liked a Tweet from popular Arsenal channel ArsenalFanTV, calling for Arsene Wenger to go. 
It's since been deleted but with the way social media is these days, there was no way he was getting let off the hook. Alex Oxlade Chamberlain likes an ArsenalFanTV video which suggests Arsène Wenger should be sacked. pic.twitter.com/nsjqH0hOkp - From The Stands (@FromTStands) February 4, 2017 even Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain is on the #WengerOut bus :bus: this week ....check out his latest like #chears pic.twitter.com/TvYmzfjff2
